data.title: Five acts announced to support Taylor Swift on her 'Eras Tour' including RAYE
data.meta_description: Taylor Swift announces support acts for 'Eras Tour' in Wembley, including RAYE, Maisie Peters, Suki Waterhouse, Holly Humberstone and Sofia Isella.
data.text:
They'll be taking to the stage at Wembley

Later this month, Taylor Swift will be returning to the UK, taking 'The Eras Tour' to London, where she will be playing five nights at Wembley Stadium. Now, the singer has announced five acts who will be supporting her, along with already announced Paramore, who have been touring with the 'Anti-Hero' singer.

Taking to her Instagram Stories, Taylor told her fans that each of the nights in London will have a different support act, and she has chosen each act because: 'I asked them to play on this tour because I love their music and think they'll absolutely smash it in Wembley Stadium. Go check out their music if you haven't already. Gonna be a fun 5 nights!!!' (sic)

Take a look through 'The Eras Tour' setlist:

Who will be supporting Taylor Swift at Wembley?

The full line-up of support for Taylor includes Paramore, on every night, with Sofia Isella (15th August), Holly Humberstone (16th August), Suki Waterhouse (17th August), Maisie Peters (19th August), ending with RAYE on 20th August.

Sofia Isella

Sofia Isella is a 19-year-old classically training violinist, following the announcement that she would be supporting Taylor, she posted on social media: 'Someone I‚Äôve never met has changed my life even more than she already has just through her writing alone. Your fearlessness in continuing to push yourself and win again and again is the most joyful thing to watch, Taylor. Thank you. Holy sh-t'.

Holly Humberstone

Holly Humberstone won the BRIT Award for Rising Star in 2022 and since then has had a sold-out tour in America. In response to the exciting news, she told her fans: 'The hardest secret I‚Äôve ever had to keep. As if I get to support Taylor at The Eras Tour !!!!!! pinch me !!!!! @taylorswift thank you thank you thank you I am eternally grateful what an honour, I have no words & I can‚Äôt fuck-n wait for the 16th ! See you üîú Wembley üíï'.

Suki Waterhouse

Model and singer Suki Waterhouse, has her second album 'Memoir of a Sparklemuffin' due out later this year. Telling her fans what it meant to her to be supporting Taylor she said: 'It feels like an honour to simply exist at the same time as @taylorswift, let alone be an opener for her on the biggest and best tour ever üò≠üò≠üò≠

'A dream come true that I never want to wake up from. Playing at wembley stadium in my hometown!!!'

Maisie Peters

Maisie Peters supported Ed Sheeran on tour back in 2022/23, and now she's joining Taylor Swift for a night at Wembley! She wrote: 'i can‚Äôt believe i am writing this ‚Ä¶. SEE YOU AT THE ERAS TOUR ON AUGUST 19TH üò≠

'supporting taylor swift has been my dream since i was 12 years old and watched the love story music video for the first time. it is such an honour to be part of something so special and iconic and i already know im gonna have the time of my life :‚Äô) thank u dr @taylorswift . SCREAM !!!!!' (sic)

RAYE

RAYE made history earlier this year when received the most BRIT Award nominations in one year. Among the accolades, she took home the BRIT Award for the highly prestigious Album of the Year, for her debut release 'My 21st Century Blues'.

You can hear songs by Taylor Swift on Hits Radio.
